nodes.bodyText: Is there a chance that a concurrent modification exception is thrown here?
You are right. The command isn't triggered during normal circumstances in the testsuite. It's fixed now.
Same: Is there a chance that a concurrent modification exception is thrown here?
Same as above
I would add javadocs for the new methods.

I wish there was a cleaner way of doing this, but that probably would require some major refactoring. Starting with Java 9 there is a static Map.entry(key, value) method that would avoid the whole creation of a HashMap just to get the single entry in it, but it is unfortunately not availble to us right now.
As the original collection is a HashSet, wouldn't it be better to use distinct() in the returned stream here?
You are right, I forgot to add distinct() everywhere.
Risk of ConcurrentModification here or not?
Right, I forgot to collect it.
Again, shouldn't this be collected before the removal?
Right, I forgot to collect it.
Shouldn't this method include a call to distinct() on the returned streams?
Should this include a call to distinct()?
Same, include a call to distinct() on the returned stream?
Same, should distinct() be called on the returned stream?
Same, should we have a call to distinct() on the constructed stream?

This seems to be used only in line 140 above, and that method gets the Set returned here and calls .stream() on it to be able to return the proper stream type. Shouldn't this one simply return the stream?

Same approach is used with roles and client scopes. My understanding is that we cache those entities to prevent multiple calls of getClientScopesStream() and getProtocolMappersStream() using this approach.
Ah, it is indeed cached, this is fine then.
Risk of ConcurrentModification?
Actually looking more into this I think my change is wrong anyway. I reverted it to original version.
Shouldn't distinct() be placed in the stream that is returned in line 531 bellow?
Yeah but probably also on line 522 in case scopeParam is null and clientScopes are returned early.
